it.polimi.travlendarplus.RESTful.authenticationManager

Class AuthenticationFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.travlendarplus.RESTful.authenticationManager.AuthenticationFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestFilter

    @Provider
 @Priority(value=1000)
public class AuthenticationFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestFilter
    This Class provide the authentication and authorization functionalities. It checks that a token, received in the HTTP request header, is correct and identify the user associated too it. All server's protected functionalities can take advantage of this functionalities simply writing the tag @Secured above the class declaration

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public void filter(javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestContext requestContext)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Checks if the received token is valid, if valid inject the user into the class that will handle the preformed request, otherwise it simply refuse the request
        Specified by:
        filter in interface javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestFilter
        Parameters:
        requestContext - context of the request, it consist in the entire HTTP request
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the request syntax is not correct

      • isTokenBasedAuthentication

        private boolean isTokenBasedAuthentication(java.lang.String authorizationHeader)
        Checks if the Authorization header is valid. It must be not null and it must be prefixed with "Bearer" plus a whitespace. The authentication scheme comparison must be case-insensitive
        Parameters:
        authorizationHeader - header of the HTTP request that is to be authenticated
        Returns:
        true if the requests contains a token, false otherwise

      • abortWithUnauthorized

        private void abortWithUnauthorized(javax.ws.rs.container.ContainerRequestContext requestContext)
        Aborts the filter chain with a 401 status code response The WWW-Authenticate header is sent along with the response
        Parameters:
        requestContext - context of the request, it consist in the entire HTTP request

      • validateToken

        private User validateToken(java.lang.String token)
                    throws InvalidTokenException
        Checks if the token was issued by the server and if it's not expired Throws an Exception if the token is invalid
        Parameters:
        token - HTTP - request's token to be checked
        Returns:
        the authenticated user
        Throws:
        InvalidTokenException - if does not exist an user associated with the token
